docs.lead_paragraph: Few things rankle Josephine Harkay more than seeing garbage thrown on the streets of her beloved Jamaica Estates. A leafy enclave of Tudor and colonial-style homes in eastern Queens, this is a neighborhood where residents worry most about the little things, those quality-of-life issues that have been such hallmarks in Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani's administration. ''I am a stickler for cleanliness,'' said Mrs. Harkay, a 69-year-old widow who has lived in the same house on Dalny Road since 1962. ''I worry about those things, keeping the character of a neighborhood.''

headline.main: Gauging the Vote of the Satisfied
headline.kicker: CAMPAIGNING FOR CITY HALL: THE BATTLEGROUND

docs.abstract: Article on issues voters in Jamaica Estates section of Queens consider important in New York City mayoral primary; describes neighborhood, including demographics; comments from residents; photos; map (M)
